intro: Cynanchum schlechtendalii, commonly known as Chinese milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has a milky sap, which is a notable feature of the genus Cynanchum. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
